verses.verse: [To the chiefe musition on Neginoth, a psalme of Dauid.] Heare me when I call O God of my righteousnesse: thou hast set me at libertie when I was in distresse.
O ye sonnes of men, how long [wyll ye go about to bryng] my glory to confusion? ye loue vanitie, ye seeke after lyes. Selah.
For ye must know that God hath chosen to him selfe a godly [man]: God wyl heare when I call vnto hym.
Be ye angry, but sinne not: commune with your owne heart in your chaumber, and be styll. Selah.
Offer the sacrifice of righteousnesse: and put your trust in God.
There be many that say, who wyll shewe vs [any] good? O God lift thou vp the light of thy countenaunce vpon vs.
Thou hast put gladnesse in my heart: since the time that their corne and wine increased.
I wyll lay me downe in peace and take my rest: for thou God only makest me to dwell in safetie.
